Legal_Issue: Credible evidence and procedural fairness in refugee protection claims
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed fear of forced marriage and female genital mutilation (FGM) upon return to Mali
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Board failed to apply Gender Guidelines but relied on other evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of forced marriage and FGM
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider Gender Guidelines in a gender-related claim
Credibility_Assessment: Testimony found vague and not credible
Did not fit typical FGM victim profile
Evidence_Used: Profile of FGM victims in Mali
Application_Basis: Well-founded fear of persecution based on gender-related grounds
Evidence_Assessed: Documentary evidence on conditions in Mali
Governing_Rule: Board must consider Gender Guidelines in gender-related claims and ensure procedural fairness
Harm_Assessment: Risk of forced marriage and FGM in Mali
Cause_Description: Fear of forced marriage and FGM upon return to Mali
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility without applying Gender Guidelines
Evidence_Issues: Lack of detail in personal narrative
Evidence_Assessment: Supporting evidence considered sufficient despite procedural error
Decision_Rationale: Conclusions not patently unreasonable despite failure to apply Gender Guidelines
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to align with recognized risk profiles
Legal_Standard_Applied: Patent unreasonableness standard on judicial review
